text: I've had samsung's newest phone the
Galaxy s8 for a while now and here's
what I think about it
[Music]
Samsung is ready for a do-over
after the galaxy note 7 debacle last
year expectations are through the roof
for the Galaxy s8 overall the Galaxy s8
is an incredible phone and it's easily
one of the best you can buy there are
several things to like here but let's
start with the first thing the design
the Galaxy s8 has a 5.8 inch screen that
covers over 80% of the front
in fact it fits more screen on a smaller
body than the iPhone 7 plus there's also
a nice curve to the screen so it looks
like there are no borders on the edges
Samsung calls this the infinity display
besides the great design there are a lot
of other things to like about the
hardware in the Galaxy s8 it's
water-resistant as a great camera and it
has wireless charging so the hardware is
top-notch but what about the software
this is where Samsung falls short
like other Galaxy phones Samsung adds
its own modifications to Android
software and these kind of ruin the
experience that Google already has the
biggest problem here is Bixby this is a
new digital assistant that Samsung built
itself now Vic sees voice features won't
work right out of the box that's coming
later this spring but it does have some
other features like a smart vision
cameras that can detect real world
objects and bring up more information
and a new Bixby home which lives to the
side of your home screen and brings up
relevant information like your calendar
alerts and fitness tracking but it's a
little weird that Samsung put 6p on this
phone considering it's an Android phone
that already has Google assistant and
Google home it's like doubling up on the
same feature and let me answer the
question are probably wondering does it
explode not at all in my time with the
Galaxy s8 it never overheated it never
got smoky or anything like that and in
fact Samsung has new procedures to test
its batteries before it puts it in a
phone overall the Galaxy s8 is about as
close to perfect as you can get in a
smart phone the hardware and design
choices are amazing and while the
software flow
in a few places it's hardly a
deal-breaker plus the price is right it
starts at 729 which is actually cheaper
than the iPhone 7 which has a smaller
screen if you need a new smartphone the
galaxy s 8 is one you should consider
[Music]
